title: Buy rude games on Steam without fear - Valve rolls out enhanced privacy
description: You! Yes you! You can now buy as many of those rude games as you like without fear of prying eyes, as Valve just rolled out some enhanced privacy features to Steam.

title: GNOME pulls in experimental variable refresh rate (VRR) support for GNOME 46
description: After years of waiting, experimental support for variable refresh rate (VRR) has landed for GNOME, and thankfully it will be in the GNOME 46 release.

title: Humble has a great Games Done Quick bundle live
description: Games Done Quick is back again with the Frost Fatales 2024, and Humble Bundle have a nice bundle of games ready for the event.

title: AMDGPU driver for Linux 6.7 enforces lower power limits from vBIOS
description: Starting with Linux kernel 6.7, users of the AMDGPU driver are not be able to set power limits below the recommended values advised by the AMD Engineering team on the hardware itself. The new low-power limits are intentionally enforced and set based on each card vBIOS specification.

title: EmuDeck removes Yuzu And Citra emulator support
description: The news of the Yuzu team agreeing to pay Nintendo $2.4 million in damages and immediately shut down all operations sent shock waves through the emulation landscape. EmuDeck will now also be removing Yuzu and Citra.

title: Building a Retro Linux Gaming Computer Part 39: Beyond Heretic
description: I stated before that neither of the contemporary HeXen ports, Linux Hexen and its fork HHexen, supported MIDI music playback through the /dev/sequencer device, but hiding on the venerable SunSITE network I found the only online trace of another early HeXen source port released in December 1999 by Russian programmer Stanislav Nesterov.
